page.title: 07Village of Southwick
page.content: Housing in Southwick has several common characteristics. Most buildings have two storeys with large back gardens, and little or no front gardens. They can be divided into 3 categories; the very old thatched cottages with large plots of land, pre-2nd World War terraced houses, made of flint, whose doors open right onto the road, and the post war houses made of red brick. There is also an estate of such houses on the edge of Southwick.{The village has grown very {little because it is owned by {Southwick Estate. There seems to be a preference to use hedgerows as barriers which are abundant in wild flora. At the southern end of Southwick, and{old {flint bridge}crosses the Wallington river.
